definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: If you want soft core you only have to look at the facebook profiles nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现在如果你想看软核的，只要上脸书看看图片就够了。

sentences.english: He estimated they accounted for less than 1 percent of the site's user base.
sentences.chinese: 他估计这些人占脸书用户群不到百分之一。

sentences.english: Pinterest and Facebook were the companies with the highest paid interns, according to the survey.
sentences.chinese: 根据他的调查，拼趣和脸书是实习生薪酬最高的公司。

sentences.english: It spans email as well as IM, text messages, and on-Facebook messages.
sentences.chinese: 它涵盖的范围包括即时通，简讯和脸书讯息。

sentences.english: Palin paid tribute to Ferraro on her Internet Facebook page on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 佩林星期六晚在自己的脸书网页上向费拉罗致敬。

definition: (Tw) private message/to send a private message
to give sb a thumbs-up (on social media)
PTT, the largest terminal-based bulletin board system in Taiwan/full name: 批踢踢實業坊|批踢踢实业坊[Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1]
(Tw) abbr. for 人肉搜索|人肉搜索[ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3]
network (computer, telecom)/Internet/Taiwanese term for 網絡|网络[wang3 luo4]
